titleStmt.title: R. Russell et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Warsaw Ky Feby 1864
To his Exelency
The Govenor of Ky

We the undersigned Citizens of Gallatin County would Respectfully represent- That at the September term 1863 of the Gallatin Circuit Court Alfred Swango a Citizen of sd County was found guilty upon two indictments of the offense of Keeping a tippling house and a Judgment rendered against him in accordance with the Statutes one for $200 and one for $60

Exceptions was taken to the rooling of the Court and and the case prepared for an appeal and a bill of the Evidence in the Cause Certified by the Judge which we deem last to send with this petition for your Excellencis inspection the papers in the Cause was not (by accident) not filed in the appelate Court in time and the cause for this reason was dismissed

We are of the opinion from the testimony in the Cause that the young man (Swang) at Last did not know that he was violating the
Law was not pretending to act for himself but only geting wages by the month doing business for another whereby thought at the time was authorized to Sell Liquors under these circumstances and knowing that he is quite a youth without means to pay a fine and of poore but respectable family we would therefore most Respectfully petition your Excellency to Remit his said fines

Se the Testimonies
R. Russell
Wm Rudd
A H Bledsoe
Geo W. Reed Sheriff Calletan
Thos Saere
Jonathan Tyson
S W. Williams

Gallatin Cir Ct
vs
Alfred Swango
2 Judgts
$200, & $60-
Tipling
Remitted
15th Mch/ 64
